title: mkgtf
description: Make a GTF file - filter by a specific attribute.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input_gtf.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `transcriptome_annotation.gtf.gz`. Reference GTF annotation
input_gtf.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `transcriptome_annotation.gtf.gz`. Reference GTF annotation.

output_gtf.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output_gtf.gz`, example: `output.gtf.gz`. Output GTF file
output_gtf.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output_gtf.gz`, example: `output.gtf.gz`. Output GTF file.

attribute.description: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `gene_type:transcribed_unprocessed_pseudogene;gene_type:miRNA`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Key-value pair in attributes field to be kept in the GTF file of the format attribute:attribute_value
attribute.help_text: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `gene_type:transcribed_unprocessed_pseudogene;gene_type:miRNA`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Key-value pair in attributes field to be kept in the GTF file of the format attribute:attribute_value.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
